bcbioRnaseq
  • Reference

Plot Volcano

Plot Volcano

plot_volcano(object, ...)

.plot_volcano(res_df, padj = TRUE, alpha = 0.05, lfc = 1L, ntop = 0L,
  direction = "both", shade_color = "green", shade_alpha = 0.25,
  point_color = "gray", point_alpha = 0.75,
  point_outline_color = "darkgray", grid = TRUE)

# S4 method for DESeqResults
plot_volcano(object, ...)

Arguments

object

Object.
...

Additional arguments.
res_df

DESeqResults coerced to a data.frame. By inputting a data.frame, we allow for increased flexibility, since a user may want to subset the results prior to plotting.
padj

Use P values adjusted for multiple comparisions.
alpha

Alpha level cutoff used for coloring.
lfc

Log fold change ratio (base 2) cutoff for coloring.
ntop

Number of top genes to label.
direction

Plot up, down, or both (default) directions.
shade_color

Shading color for bounding box.
shade_alpha

Shading transparency alpha.
point_color

Point color.
point_alpha

Point transparency alpha.
point_outline_color

Point outline color.
grid

Arrange plots into grid.

Value

Volcano plot arranged as grid (grid = TRUE), or show() individual ggplot (grid = FALSE).

See also

This function is an updated variant of CHBUtils::volcano_density_plot().

Other Differential Expression Plots: plot_ma

Examples

data(bcb)
dds <- DESeqDataSetFromTximport(
    txi = txi(bcb),
    colData = colData(bcb),
    design = formula(~group)) %>%
    DESeq
#> using just counts from tximport
#> estimating size factors
#> estimating dispersions
#> gene-wise dispersion estimates
#> mean-dispersion relationship
#> final dispersion estimates
#> fitting model and testing
res <- results(dds)
plot_volcano(res)
plot_volcano(res, padj = FALSE, lfc = 2L)
plot_volcano(res, ntop = 10L)
